data.title: Roger Daltrey to appear with Boehner at Churchill event
data.meta_description: Roger Daltrey, founder and lead singer of the English rock band \
data.text:
A little bit of "twist and shout" will accompany festivities at the Capitol next Wednesday, when a bust of former Winston Churchill is dedicated.

Roger Daltrey, founder and lead singer of the English rock band "The Who," will perform in honor of the former British Prime Minister.

House Speaker John Boehner, R-West Chester Township, embraced Daltrey's appearance as a "first-class welcome" for the bust. "What better way to celebrate Winston Churchill's friendship to the United States than to have one of Britain's most legendary recording artists perform in the halls of the Capitol," Boehner said in a statement.

The multiplatinum singer will join Secretary of State John Kerry and several congressional leaders in the celebration.

-- Sophia Lindsey
